NGS_SEQUENCING.description: Next generation sequencing experiment of a sample.

STATUS.label: Status
STATUS.description: The status of the corresponding experiment.

SEQUENCING_TECHNOLOGY.label: Sequencing Technology
SEQUENCING_TECHNOLOGY.description: The sequencing technology which has been used.

READ_MAPPER.label: Read Mapper
READ_MAPPER.description: The read mapper which has been used.

Q_EXPERIMENTAL_DESIGN.description: This is the starting point for most QBiC experiments. The experiment's general setup and goal should be described in a PDF document and attached to this instance.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_NAME.label: Experimentator's name
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_NAME.description: The person who conducted this experiment.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_EMAIL.label: Experimentator's e-mail address
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_EMAIL.description: The experimentator's e-mail address for contact purposes.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_PHONE.label: Experimentator's phone number
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_PHONE.description: The experimentator's phone number for contact purposes.

Q_EXPERIMENTAL_SETUP.label: Experiment's setup file
Q_EXPERIMENTAL_SETUP.description: This XML file stores the experiment's layout and is not meant to be seen by the end user.

Q_CURRENT_STATUS.label: Experiment's current status
Q_CURRENT_STATUS.description: This field is meant to be used for internal use only.

Q_NOTES.label: Notes
Q_NOTES.description: Notes that can be added by different users. Contains each note, user that added it with full name and timestamp of the addition.

Q_SAMPLE_EXTRACTION.description: Describes the protocol how the biological samples are obtained from the studied biological entities. The protocol may also contain information about how and where the samples are stored.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_NAME.description: The person who conducted this experiment.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_EMAIL.label: Experimentator's e-mail address
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_EMAIL.description: The experimentator's e-mail address for contact purposes.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_PHONE.label: Experimentator's phone number
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_PHONE.description: The experimentator's phone number for contact purposes.

Q_CURRENT_STATUS.label: Experiment's current status
Q_CURRENT_STATUS.description: This field is meant to be used for internal use only.

Q_CELL_HARVESTING_METHOD.label: Cell harvesting method
Q_CELL_HARVESTING_METHOD.description: Method used to harvest cells from growth medium or under other circumstances

Q_CELL_LYSIS_PARAMETERS.label: Cell lysis parameters
Q_CELL_LYSIS_PARAMETERS.description: Additional information used to specify temperature, pressure, enzymes etc. used for cell lysis

Q_CELL_LYSIS_METHOD.label: Cell lysis method
Q_CELL_LYSIS_METHOD.description: One or more methods used to lyse cells

Q_CELL_HARVESTING_VOLUME.label: Cell harvesting volume
Q_CELL_HARVESTING_VOLUME.description: Volume harvested from a cell culture

Q_NOTES.label: Notes
Q_NOTES.description: Notes that can be added by different users. Contains each note, user that added it with full name and timestamp of the addition.

Q_SAMPLE_PREPARATION.description: Holds information about the biological samples' preparation (e.g., for a specific analytic method). Creates test samples that can be actually measured. Sample prep protocol should be attached as a PDF document.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_NAME.description: The person who conducted this experiment.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_EMAIL.description: The experimentator's e-mail address for contact purposes.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_PHONE.label: Experimentator's phone number
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_PHONE.description: The experimentator's phone number for contact purposes.

Q_CURRENT_STATUS.label: Experiment's current status
Q_CURRENT_STATUS.description: This field is meant to be used for internal use only.

Q_MS_FRACTIONATION_METHOD.label: Mass spectrometry fractionation method
Q_MS_FRACTIONATION_METHOD.description: Protein or peptide fractionation protocol used for preparation of mass spectrometry samples.

Q_MS_ENRICHMENT_METHOD.label: Protein Enrichment Method
Q_MS_ENRICHMENT_METHOD.description: Method to enrich certain proteins. Each resulting samples typically corresponds to one enrichment cycle

Q_MS_PURIFICATION_METHOD.label: Protein Purification Method
Q_MS_PURIFICATION_METHOD.description: Method used to purify proteins before measurement

Q_LABELING_METHOD.label: Labeling Method
Q_LABELING_METHOD.description: Method of labeling a sample (category, not individual label)

Q_DIGESTION_METHOD.label: Digestion Method
Q_DIGESTION_METHOD.description: Digestion of samples via enzymes or other chemicals.

Q_MS_ENRICHMENT_METHOD_DETAILED.label: Detailed Enrichment Method
Q_MS_ENRICHMENT_METHOD_DETAILED.description: Method used to do the enrichment specified in other attributes

Q_MS_FRACTIONATION_METHOD_OTHER.label: Detailed Fractionation Method
Q_MS_FRACTIONATION_METHOD_OTHER.description: Detailed Fractionation Method not found in the other vocabulary

Q_SAMPLE_PREPARATION_METHOD.label: Sample Preparation Method
Q_SAMPLE_PREPARATION_METHOD.description: Method used to prepare analyte samples

Q_NOTES.label: Notes
Q_NOTES.description: Notes that can be added by different users. Contains each note, user that added it with full name and timestamp of the addition.

Q_NGS_EPITOPE_PREDICTION.description: This is an epitope prediction experiment. Computational tools are used to predict whether given peptides may bind to specified MHC alleles.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_CURRENT_STATUS.label: Experiment's current status
Q_CURRENT_STATUS.description: This field is meant to be used for internal use only.

Q_NGS_HLATYPING.description: This is a HLA typing experiment. Typing can be done via 'traditional' typing method or via in silico experiment (using OptiType).

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_CURRENT_STATUS.label: Experiment's current status
Q_CURRENT_STATUS.description: This field is meant to be used for internal use only.

Q_HLA_CLASS.label: HLA Class
Q_HLA_CLASS.description: The class of the corresponding HLA type.

Q_HLA_TYPING_METHOD.label: HLA Typing Method
Q_HLA_TYPING_METHOD.description: The experimental method which has been used to determine the HLA Type.

Q_PROPERTIES.label: Properties
Q_PROPERTIES.description: Properties that are characteristic to this biological entity/sample. These could be experimental factors (e.g., duration of treatment) or class information (e.g., WT or KO mouse, healthy versus diseased).

Q_NGS_IMMUNE_MONITORING.description: This is an immune monitoring experiment which is used to keep track of immune responses during a vaccination phase including multiple timepoints and measurements.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_CURRENT_STATUS.label: Experiment's current status
Q_CURRENT_STATUS.description: This field is meant to be used for internal use only.

Q_NGS_MAPPING.description: This is a NGS mapping experiment which is used to align genomic data to some reference.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_CURRENT_STATUS.label: Experiment's current status
Q_CURRENT_STATUS.description: This field is meant to be used for internal use only.

Q_NGS_MEASUREMENT.description: This is a Next Generation Sequencing experiment which is used to sequence some biological sample producing raw NGS data, i.e., fastq files.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_NAME.label: Experimentator's name
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_NAME.description: The person who conducted this experiment.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_EMAIL.label: Experimentator's e-mail address
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_EMAIL.description: The experimentator's e-mail address for contact purposes.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_PHONE.label: Experimentator's phone number
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_PHONE.description: The experimentator's phone number for contact purposes.

Q_SEQUENCER_DEVICE.label: Sequencer device
Q_SEQUENCER_DEVICE.description: This field's code specifies the actual sequencer device together with its location.

Q_SEQUENCER_PARAMS.label: Sequencer software parameters
Q_SEQUENCER_PARAMS.description: This field may store specific NGS software parameters and their settings in an XML file.

Q_SEQUENCING_MODE.label: Sequencing mode
Q_SEQUENCING_MODE.description: Specifies if the sequencing is done in single-end or paired-end fashion.

Q_SEQUENCING_TYPE.label: Sequencing type
Q_SEQUENCING_TYPE.description: Specifies what exactly is sequenced in this experiment.

Q_ILLUMINA_RUN_MODE.label: Illumina run mode
Q_ILLUMINA_RUN_MODE.description: Specifies the Illumina's run mode (mid or high output, rapid).

Q_DEEP_SEQUENCING.label: Deep sequencing
Q_DEEP_SEQUENCING.description: Specifies if deep sequencing was employed or not.

Q_READ_LENGTH.label: Read length
Q_READ_LENGTH.description: The read length (bp) required by the experimentator.

Q_SEQUENCING_CYCLES.label: Sequencing cycles
Q_SEQUENCING_CYCLES.description: Number of sequencing cycles as required by the experimentator.

Q_SEQUENCER_SOFTWARE.label: Sequencer software
Q_SEQUENCER_SOFTWARE.description: Specifies the sequencer's exact software version.

Q_LIBRARY_PREPKIT.label: Library prep kit
Q_LIBRARY_PREPKIT.description: Specifies the preparation kit that was used to build the DNA/RNA library.

Q_SEQUENCING_CHEMISTRY.label: Sequencing chemistry type
Q_SEQUENCING_CHEMISTRY.description: Specifies the type of sequencing chemistry.

Q_DEMUX_SOFTWARE.label: Demultiplexing software
Q_DEMUX_SOFTWARE.description: Specifies the exact name and version of the software employed for the demultiplexing of sequencing data.

Q_MEASUREMENT_START_DATE.label: Measurement's starting date
Q_MEASUREMENT_START_DATE.description: Specifies the date/time when a measurement is started.

Q_MEASUREMENT_FINISH_DATE.label: Measurement's finish date
Q_MEASUREMENT_FINISH_DATE.description: Specifies the date/time when a measurement is finished.

Q_EST_DATA_VOLUME.label: Estimated data volume
Q_EST_DATA_VOLUME.description: A rough estimate of the experiment's total data volume.

Q_ACT_DATA_VOLUME.label: Actual data volume
Q_ACT_DATA_VOLUME.description: Shows the actual data volume reserved by this experiment. This field is computed automatically.

Q_CURRENT_STATUS.label: Experiment's current status
Q_CURRENT_STATUS.description: This field is meant to be used for internal use only.

Q_MS_MEASUREMENT.description: Describes an MS-based experiment, usually coupled with a separation technique (e.g., liquid chromatography).

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_NAME.label: Experimentator's name
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_NAME.description: The person who conducted this experiment.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_EMAIL.label: Experimentator's e-mail address
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_EMAIL.description: The experimentator's e-mail address for contact purposes.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_PHONE.label: Experimentator's phone number
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_PHONE.description: The experimentator's phone number for contact purposes.

Q_MS_PROTOCOL.label: MS protocol
Q_MS_PROTOCOL.description: Designates the general MS protocol for this measurement (e.g. targeted metabolomics). Details are given in the attached document.

Q_CHROMATOGRAPHY_TYPE.label: Chromatography type
Q_CHROMATOGRAPHY_TYPE.description: Specifies the kind of chromatography that is coupled to the mass spectrometer.

Q_CHROMATOGRAPHY_PROPERTIES.label: Chromatography properties
Q_CHROMATOGRAPHY_PROPERTIES.description: Technical specifications of the chromatography column in use.

Q_MS_DEVICE.label: MS device
Q_MS_DEVICE.description: The MS device that is used to conduct the experiment.

Q_IONIZATION_MODE.label: Ionization mode
Q_IONIZATION_MODE.description: Specifies if the measurement was conducted with positive or negative ionization mode.

Q_MSDEV_PROPERTIES.label: MS device properties
Q_MSDEV_PROPERTIES.description: Contains MS-related operational and software parameters.

Q_MS_CONTROL_SOFTWARE.label: MS control software
Q_MS_CONTROL_SOFTWARE.description: Specifies the instrument control software (e.g., for instrument configuration and initial data processing).

Q_MS_CONVERSION_SOFTWARE.label: MS conversion software
Q_MS_CONVERSION_SOFTWARE.description: Specifies the software and its version that was used to convert the vendor-specific formats to mzML.

Q_EST_DATA_VOLUME.label: Estimated data volume
Q_EST_DATA_VOLUME.description: A rough estimate of the experiment's total data volume.

Q_ACT_DATA_VOLUME.label: Actual data volume
Q_ACT_DATA_VOLUME.description: Shows the actual data volume reserved by this experiment. This field is computed automatically.

Q_CURRENT_STATUS.label: Experiment's current status
Q_CURRENT_STATUS.description: This field is meant to be used for internal use only.

Q_MS_LCMS_METHOD.label: LCMS Method
Q_MS_LCMS_METHOD.description: Labratory specific parameters for LCMS measurements.

Q_PROTEASE_DIGESTION.label: Protease Digestion
Q_PROTEASE_DIGESTION.description: Proteases and chemicals used to digest proteins of an MS experiment into peptides.

Q_MEASUREMENT_FINISH_DATE.label: Measurement's finish date
Q_MEASUREMENT_FINISH_DATE.description: Specifies the date/time when a measurement is finished.

Q_CHROMATOGRAPHY_COLUMN_NAME.label: LC Column Name
Q_CHROMATOGRAPHY_COLUMN_NAME.description: Internal name for a column used in chromatography experiments

Q_MS_MIDDLE_DOWN_INFORMATION.label: Middle Down Proteomics Information
Q_MS_MIDDLE_DOWN_INFORMATION.description: Information, if and which middle-down approach was used

Q_NOTES.label: Notes
Q_NOTES.description: Notes that can be added by different users. Contains each note, user that added it with full name and timestamp of the addition.

Q_WASHING_SOLVENT.label: Washing solvent
Q_WASHING_SOLVENT.description: Solvent used to wash HPLC columns and similar

Q_LC_DEVICE.label: Liquid Chromatography Device
Q_LC_DEVICE.description: Device used to perform Liquid Chromatography

Q_LC_DETECTION_METHOD.label: LC detection method
Q_LC_DETECTION_METHOD.description: Method used to detect components in HPLC

Q_MS_DISSOCIATION_ENERGY.label: Dissociation energy
Q_MS_DISSOCIATION_ENERGY.description: Energy for an ion experiencing collision with a stationary gas particle resulting in dissociation of the ion. [ PSI:MS ]

Q_MS_DISSOCIATION_METHOD.label: Dissociation method
Q_MS_DISSOCIATION_METHOD.description: Fragmentation method used for dissociation or fragmentation.

Q_MS_RESOLVING_POWER.label: Mass resolving power
Q_MS_RESOLVING_POWER.description:
Mass Resolving Power is defined as m/dm
Where m designates the mass and dm the peak width necessary for separation at mass m. A specific m/z value and also the method like 10% valley or 50% valley or full width at half maximum (FWHM) must be given. Resolving power is usually a large number (up to 2,000,000 for FT-MS) and is used as “performance” parameter.

Q_WF_MS_QUALITYCONTROL.description: OpenMS-based quality control workflow to assess the reproducibility of a series of LC-MS measurements (mzML).

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_MAXQUANT_IDENT_ONLY.description: Specifies whether MaxQuant does protein identification runs only or together with quantification.

Q_WF_NAME.description: Name of the workflow that is executed in this experiment.

Q_WF_RUNTIME.description: Time between creation of workflow experiment and registration of results in openBIS

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_NMR_MEASUREMENT.description: NMR experiment for small molecule detection.

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_NAME.label: Experimentator's name
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_NAME.description: The person who conducted this experiment.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_EMAIL.label: Experimentator's e-mail address
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_EMAIL.description: The experimentator's e-mail address for contact purposes.

Q_NMR_QUANTIFICATION_METHOD.label: NMR quantification method
Q_NMR_QUANTIFICATION_METHOD.description: Quantification method used for NMR metabolite analysis.

Q_NGS_NANOPORE_RUN.description: Nanopore sequencing experiment on one or more samples

Q_SEQUENCER_DEVICE.label: Sequencer device
Q_SEQUENCER_DEVICE.description: This field's code specifies the actual sequencer device together with its location.

Q_LIBRARY_PREPKIT.label: Library prep kit
Q_LIBRARY_PREPKIT.description: Specifies the preparation kit that was used to build the DNA/RNA library.

Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.label: External DB identifier
Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.description: This field facilitates the cross-linking to external databases outside the QBiC (e.g., confidential patient databases).

Q_DATA_GENERATION_FACILITY.label: Data Generation Facility
Q_DATA_GENERATION_FACILITY.description: Facility this experiment data was generated at.

Q_FLOWCELL_POSITION.label: Flowcell position
Q_FLOWCELL_POSITION.description: Specifies the position on the sequencer (e.g. Promethion) where the flow cell was placed.

Q_MEASUREMENT_START_DATE.label: Measurement's starting date
Q_MEASUREMENT_START_DATE.description: Specifies the date/time when a measurement is started.

Q_NGS_BASE_CALLER.label: Base caller
Q_NGS_BASE_CALLER.description: Software or hardware/software component used to identify/assign a nucleobase to raw NGS read data.

Q_NANOPORE_HOSTNAME.label: Nanopore sequencer hostname
Q_NANOPORE_HOSTNAME.description: Hostname of the nanopore sequencing device as it is found in the log files of a run

Q_FLOWCELL_TYPE.label: Flow Cell Product Code
Q_FLOWCELL_TYPE.description: Type, denoted by product code, of a flow cell

Q_ASIC_TEMPERATURE.label: ASIC Temperature
Q_ASIC_TEMPERATURE.description: Temperature of an application-specific integrated circuit, as it is used in some NGS or other data acquisition devices.

Q_FLOWCELL_BARCODE.label: Flowcell barcode
Q_FLOWCELL_BARCODE.description: Specifies the flowcell used for the sequencing run.

Q_SEQUENCING_ADAPTER.label: Sequencing Device Adapter
Q_SEQUENCING_ADAPTER.description: Describes adapters and their version, like the "Flongle" for Nanopore Sequencing

Q_NGS_BASE_CALLER_VERSION.label: Base caller version
Q_NGS_BASE_CALLER_VERSION.description: Version of the base calling software

Q_BMI_MODALITY.label: Imaging Modality
Q_BMI_MODALITY.description: Distinguishes the type of imaging by its modality (CT guided biopsy, dynamic CT, MR, PET, MR-PET).

Q_NOTES.label: Notes
Q_NOTES.description: Notes that can be added by different users. Contains each note, user that added it with full name and timestamp of the addition.

Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.label: External DB identifier
Q_EXTERNALDB_ID.description: This field facilitates the cross-linking to external databases outside the QBiC (e.g., confidential patient databases).

Q_SECONDARY_NAME.label: Secondary name
Q_SECONDARY_NAME.description: While an experiment is unambiguously identified by an unique code, this secondary name might be used as a more descriptive label for the experiment or sample (e.g., "Shotgun proteomics experiment #120", "Plasma sample #33"). Also, often labs want to keep of their their in-house labels.

Q_INSTRUMENT_USER.label: Instrument User
Q_INSTRUMENT_USER.description: User responsible for data generation using an instrument.

Q_MEASUREMENT_FINISH_DATE.label: Measurement's finish date
Q_MEASUREMENT_FINISH_DATE.description: Specifies the date/time when a measurement is finished.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_NAME.label: Experimentator's name
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_NAME.description: The person who conducted this experiment.

Q_CONDUCTED_BY_EMAIL.label: Experimentator's e-mail address
Q_CONDUCTED_BY_EMAIL.description: The experimentator's e-mail address for contact purposes.

Q_PIPELINE_START_DATE.label: Pipeline start date
Q_PIPELINE_START_DATE.description: Date and time of pipeline run start

Q_PIPELINE_INFRASTRUCTURE.label: Computational infrastructure
Q_PIPELINE_INFRASTRUCTURE.description: A computional infrastructure/cluster used by QBiC

RNA_MICROARRAY.description: A microarray experiment to measure RNA abundance

Q_NGS_READ_MATCH_ALIGNMENT.description: Denotes the use of MALT (MEGAN alignment tool) to create RMA (read-match archive) files that are attached to the corresponding RUN samples.

INFO_EXPERIMENT.description: Experiment instance to attach information samples that have datasets

CLINICAL_SAMPLE.description: The clinical sample of a patient.
